channel.title: Paypal Subscription
channel.description:
Somebody subscribed to something on paypal, which says they must pay £20 to me annually. I doubt the person actually wants the service they subscribed to anymore because they no longer use it and last used it for a few days in June this year when they first paid for it. However they have not canceled the subscription so I was wondering if they would be given a choice or anything when it comes to June 2010.
What happens when you have to renew a subscription? Is the person sent an email asking them if they wish to pay, or are they just notified that the payment has been taken automatically? What happens if they don't have enough money in their account?
[code] 2* Jun 2009 Payment From ****** Completed 2* Jun 2009 Subscription Creation From ****** Active [/code]
Then when I click on the one that says active: [code] Active Subscriptions: You have automatic payments scheduled for this subscription. [/code]
So do I have a chance at getting phree gps?

item.title: Paypal Subscription
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“inertia, post:5, topic:323175”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=419590.msg3082718#msg3082718 date=1262281051]

It’s not monthly it’s annually, but that’s all the detail paypal gives me. I imagine the person has a ‘stop subscription’ button somewhere on paypal, but I don’t believe they will end it unless they were actually asked if the payment may proceed.

It will stop on the said date (if it’s non-reoccurring) unless they terminate their subscription earlier. iirc, non-reoccurring payments don’t ask for conformation.
[/quote]

All it says is “You have automatic payments scheduled for this subscription.”, so does this mean it’s a non-reoccurring payment? And why would a non-reoccurring payment need to ask for confirmation in the first place, if they never have to pay again :S[/quote]
It is reoccurring, I wrote the other side of situation by accident - just reverse what I said.

Read full topic

item.title: Paypal Subscription
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:4, topic:323175”][quote author=inertia link=topic=419590.msg3082707#msg3082707 date=1262280727]
It’s not monthly it’s annually, but that’s all the detail paypal gives me. I imagine the person has a ‘stop subscription’ button somewhere on paypal, but I don’t believe they will end it unless they were actually asked if the payment may proceed.
[/quote]
It will stop on the said date (if it’s non-reoccurring) unless they terminate their subscription earlier. iirc, non-reoccurring payments don’t ask for conformation.[/quote]

All it says is “You have automatic payments scheduled for this subscription.”, so does this mean it’s a non-reoccurring payment? And why would a non-reoccurring payment need to ask for confirmation in the first place, if they never have to pay again :S

Read full topic

Depends if the subscription was reoccurring annually or a strictly monthly payment.

item.title: Paypal Subscription
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Somebody subscribed to something on paypal, which says they must pay £20 to me annually. I doubt the person actually wants the service they subscribed to anymore because they no longer use it and last used it for a few days in June this year when they first paid for it. However they have not canceled the subscription so I was wondering if they would be given a choice or anything when it comes to June 2010.

What happens when you have to renew a subscription? Is the person sent an email asking them if they wish to pay, or are they just notified that the payment has been taken automatically? What happens if they don’t have enough money in their account?

2* Jun 2009 	  	Payment			From	******	Completed 
2* Jun 2009 	  	Subscription Creation	From	******	Active

Then when I click on the one that says active:

Active
      Subscriptions: You have automatic payments scheduled for this subscription.

So do I have a chance at getting phree gps?

Read full topic
